intro: Staphidium lindenianum, commonly known as the Lindenberg's staphidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by various bird species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant.
